intro: Phlomoides kaufmanniana, commonly known as the Kaufmann's phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, pale blue to violet flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
